post.body: Clyde was really mellow, but he was trained by the stray collie, who acted almost comatose. Jackson is way more active!
I'll twitpic some more of them for you when I get back to FW for Christmas.
My parents currently have *3* of the hounds. One is getting very old. But they've rescued too, as well as had great mutts. :)
I barely know the meaning of those words these days. Plus, I'd be wearing Mountain Hardwear. :)
Nice hedgehog. Stay tuned for what happens to them in this house.
I could only disappoint myself, as all the $ now goes for gas & freeze dried. More than enough time to get another, though.
Congrats on the office Joe! The truck hit 235K on this trip and rolling strong.
Spend them wisely, my friend.
Screw it, the rabbits seem fine. G'night!
My planned truck bivy near Cactus, TX is apparently being foiled by all the signs reading "POISONOUS GAS -hydrogen sulfide- may be present".
Wichita Falls, TX - Yo La Tengo, Summer Sun
Decatur, TX - NPR, All Things Considered
Fort Worth, TX - Delgados, Universal Audio
Smartest dog I've known is Clyde, who died about 4 years ago. Border collie mix. Dude had a working vocabulary in the triple digits.
http://twitpic.com/tdoo - Dachshunds are funny because they sit like this
Somehow finally successful at wiping Blackberry memory with broken trackball and cracked screen. Whew.
Fatalism giving way to technology-throwing.
Tehcnology issues. Frustration giving way to fatalism.
Unfortunately there are probably 6 billion ladies and gents that have a better shot than me.
$92 mil? Next on my list: wooing Madonna.
Mercury Rev on KCRW tomorrow (Tue.) at 11:15a Pacific. 89.9 Santa Monica or kcrw.com.
Here to tell you, 10 degree wind chill is a mite nippy in a t-shirt.
Unless of course you need a brand spanking new North Face softshell for your hot date downtown tonight!
After 8 years of shopping at the REI Seattle Flagship, Backwoods in FW is a *serious* FAIL. They don't really carry anything useful.
Interstate 35 from Hillsboro to San Antonio is a failure of Iraq magnitude.
Really strong wind out of the south. Which is probably why it's pushing 70 degrees.
Heading to Waco with my dad to bring some of his furniture back to FW.
http://twitpic.com/wj3t - Christmas Day Alligator Massacre (gory)
http://twitpic.com/whg2 - My cousin's 3 m.o. dog Hurley likes to be buried under the leaves
"What choo talkin' 'bout, everybody." Merry Christmas all!
Though our usual Christmas Eve dinner is tenderloin and a first-growth Bordeaux, we're co-opting another XMas tradition tonight - tamales!
If you haven't yet bought my present, I'm looking for a ~$400 tattoo (if done well), a laptop, and a RMI guided trip on Rainier this summer.
Cities *much* smaller do so much better. Some people in FW don't want to drive to Dallas everytime they need something.
Why does Fort Worth tolerate such utter crap and chain stores? "And they all sell only ticky-tacky and they all look just the same."
"...it's not the beer cans that are ugly; it's the highway that is ugly." - Edward Abbey. Though I don't litter, I respect the sentiment.
I couldn't bring myself to XMas shop in Old Town ABQ even though there were a few gems among the dreck. Out to make FW a pedestrian town. :)
Yikes! I accidentally unfollowed a couple of my oldest and favoritest Seattle Tweeps. Apologies for the re-follow guys!
Made Fort Worth.
Realized I was driving right past a mesa that I was carrying reports for. Hit unnamed point (4360+'), the highpoint of Oldham Co., TX.
I have info on a few TX co.s, but they would require alot of detour. Heading home for the holidays.
